alert.note: Alert for Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 14 at 11:17PM EST until January 15 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, with up to 15 inches possible in the most persistent lake effect bands. * WHERE...Southeastern St. Lawrence and Southwestern St. Lawrence Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility with locally near whiteout conditions possible at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...If traveling, be prepared for rapidly changing road conditions and visibilities. In addition, sub- zero wind chill values are expected tonight, which increases the risk of cold exposure or hypothermia for travelers who get disoriented or stranded.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence
